info.title: openconfig-wifi-phy
info.description:
Model for managing PHY layer configuration of Radio interfaces.

**Module:** `openconfig-wifi-phy`
**Paths:** 11

get.description:
Top level container for radios, including configuration
        and state data.

put.description:
Create or replace Top level container for radios, including configuration
        and state data.

patch.description:
Partially modify Top level container for radios, including configuration
        and state data.

delete.description:
Delete Top level container for radios, including configuration
        and state data.

get.description:
Configurable items at the global, radio interface
            level

put.description:
Create or replace Configurable items at the global, radio interface
            level

patch.description:
Partially modify Configurable items at the global, radio interface
            level

delete.description:
Delete Configurable items at the global, radio interface
            level

get.description: Operational state data at the global radio level

put.description: Create or replace Operational state data at the global radio level

patch.description: Partially modify Operational state data at the global radio level

delete.description: Delete Operational state data at the global radio level

get.description: The list of radios on the device. (collection)

post.description: Add a new entry to The list of radios on the device. (collection)

get.description: The list of radios on the device.

put.description: Create or replace The list of radios on the device.

patch.description: Partially modify The list of radios on the device.

delete.description: Delete The list of radios on the device.

put.description:

patch.description:

            level

patch.description: Partially modify Operational state data at the global radio level

get.description: The list of radios on the device. (collection)

get.description:

            level

put.description:
Create or replace Configurable items at the global, radio interface
            level

patch.description:

delete.description:
Delete Configurable items at the global, radio interface
            level

get.description: Operational state data at the global radio level

put.description: Create or replace Operational state data at the global radio level

patch.description: Partially modify Operational state data at the global radio level

delete.description: Delete Operational state data at the global radio level

id.description: References the configured id of the radio

enabled.description: The desired operational state (up/down) of this radio interface.

transmit-power.description: Transmit power of the radio, in dBm.

channel.description:
The channel of this neighboring BSSID. This is to utilize 802.11ac
        nomenclature. For example, 40MHz channel 36-40 represented as
        channel 38. primary-channel used to identify the primary
        20MHz channel of the neighbor.

dca.description: Utilize Dynamic Channel Assignment on this Radio.

dtp.description: Utilize dynamic transmit-power on this Radio.

dtp-min.description:
Minimum allowed transmit-power on this radio, if utilizing dtp.
        Expressed in dBm.

dtp-max.description:
Maximum allowed transmit-power on this radio, if utilizing dtp.
        Expressed in dBm.

antenna-gain.description:
Antenna gain applied to this Radio; typically used when
        external antennae connected.

scanning.description:
Whether the radio will perform off-channel scanning, to collect
        neighboring RF information.

scanning-interval.description:
How often, in seconds, the radio will go off-channel to perform
        scanning.

scanning-dwell-time.description:
Amount of time, in milliseconds, the radio will spend on a
        channel during scanning-interval. If a Monitor-mode Radio, it will
        cycle through scanning-allowed-channels spending this amount of time
        on each.

scanning-defer-clients.description:
Do not perform scanning if this amount of Stations are Associated
        to the Radio.

scanning-defer-traffic.description:
Do not perform scanning if any traffic received from an active Station
        in the past 100ms marked as AC_VO or AC_VI.

items.description: Allowed channel list for this Radio to utilize.

base-radio-mac.description:
Represents the 'burned-in' base-radio MAC
        address for the a Radio interface.

dfs-hit-time.description:
Reports the time of the last DFS hit. The value is the timestamp
        in nanoseconds relative to the Unix Epoch (Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

channel-change-reason.description:
When an Access Point changes channels, this will
        provide the reason that led to the change.

total-channel-utilization.description:
Total 802.11 and non-802.11 channel utilization on this Radio. The
        total channel utilization should include all time periods the AP
        spent actively receiving and transmitting 802.11 frames, and also
        include all time spent with clear channel assessment (CCA) in a
        busy state

rx-noise-channel-utilization.description: Received channel-utilization percentage due to Noise.

failed-fcs-frames.description: Number of frames that failed the FCS

noise-floor.description: Noise Floor, as measured by this radio.

failed-fcs-frames.description: Number of frames that failed the FCS

noise-floor.description: Noise Floor, as measured by this radio.

counters.description: A collection of radio-related statistics objects.

ssid.description: The SSID of this neighboring BSSID.

rssi.description: The RSSI of this neighboring BSSID.

primary-channel.description:
The primary 20MHz channel, if the neighbor is operating on bonded
        channel.

last-seen.description:
Reports the time this reading was taken, indicating when this neighbor
        was last seen. If a cache is used, it MUST be updated instantly when a
        neighbor BSS changes channels, or a new BSS is seen. The value is the
        timestamp in nanoseconds relative to the Unix Epoch
        (Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

rssi.description: The RSSI of this neighboring BSSID.

        nomenclature. For example, 40MHz channel 36-40 represented as
        channel 38. primary-channel used to identify the primary
        20MHz channel of the neighbor.

The primary 20MHz channel, if the neighbor is operating on bonded
        channel.

        was last seen. If a cache is used, it MUST be updated instantly when a
        neighbor BSS changes channels, or a new BSS is seen. The value is the
        timestamp in nanoseconds relative to the Unix Epoch
        (Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

enabled.description: The desired operational state (up/down) of this radio interface.

transmit-power.description: Transmit power of the radio, in dBm.

channel.description:
Operating channel of this radio. If using channel-bonding this
        will represent the Primary 20MHz channel of the 40,80,160MHz channel.

dca.description: Utilize Dynamic Channel Assignment on this Radio.

dtp.description: Utilize dynamic transmit-power on this Radio.

dtp-min.description:
Minimum allowed transmit-power on this radio, if utilizing dtp.
        Expressed in dBm.

dtp-max.description:
Maximum allowed transmit-power on this radio, if utilizing dtp.
        Expressed in dBm.

antenna-gain.description:
Antenna gain applied to this Radio; typically used when
        external antennae connected.

scanning.description:
Whether the radio will perform off-channel scanning, to collect
        neighboring RF information.

scanning-interval.description:
How often, in seconds, the radio will go off-channel to perform
        scanning.

scanning-dwell-time.description:
Amount of time, in milliseconds, the radio will spend on a
        channel during scanning-interval. If a Monitor-mode Radio, it will
        cycle through scanning-allowed-channels spending this amount of time
        on each.

scanning-defer-clients.description:
Do not perform scanning if this amount of Stations are Associated
        to the Radio.

scanning-defer-traffic.description:
Do not perform scanning if any traffic received from an active Station
        in the past 100ms marked as AC_VO or AC_VI.

items.description: Allowed channel list for this Radio to utilize.

        (Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

ssid.description: The SSID of this neighboring BSSID.

rssi.description: The RSSI of this neighboring BSSID.

channel.description:
The channel of this neighboring BSSID. This is to utilize 802.11ac
        nomenclature. For example, 40MHz channel 36-40 represented as
        channel 38. primary-channel used to identify the primary
        20MHz channel of the neighbor.

primary-channel.description:
The primary 20MHz channel, if the neighbor is operating on bonded
        channel.

last-seen.description:
Reports the time this reading was taken, indicating when this neighbor
        was last seen. If a cache is used, it MUST be updated instantly when a
        neighbor BSS changes channels, or a new BSS is seen. The value is the
        timestamp in nanoseconds relative to the Unix Epoch
        (Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

ssid.description: The SSID of this neighboring BSSID.

rssi.description: The RSSI of this neighboring BSSID.

channel.description:
The channel of this neighboring BSSID. This is to utilize 802.11ac
        nomenclature. For example, 40MHz channel 36-40 represented as
        channel 38. primary-channel used to identify the primary
        20MHz channel of the neighbor.

primary-channel.description:
The primary 20MHz channel, if the neighbor is operating on bonded
        channel.

last-seen.description:
Reports the time this reading was taken, indicating when this neighbor
        was last seen. If a cache is used, it MUST be updated instantly when a
        neighbor BSS changes channels, or a new BSS is seen. The value is the
        timestamp in nanoseconds relative to the Unix Epoch
        (Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

enabled.description: The desired operational state (up/down) of this radio interface.

transmit-power.description: Transmit power of the radio, in dBm.

channel.description:
Operating channel of this radio. If using channel-bonding this
        will represent the Primary 20MHz channel of the 40,80,160MHz channel.

dca.description: Utilize Dynamic Channel Assignment on this Radio.

dtp.description: Utilize dynamic transmit-power on this Radio.

dtp-min.description:
Minimum allowed transmit-power on this radio, if utilizing dtp.
        Expressed in dBm.

dtp-max.description:
Maximum allowed transmit-power on this radio, if utilizing dtp.
        Expressed in dBm.

antenna-gain.description:
Antenna gain applied to this Radio; typically used when
        external antennae connected.

scanning.description:
Whether the radio will perform off-channel scanning, to collect
        neighboring RF information.

scanning-interval.description:
How often, in seconds, the radio will go off-channel to perform
        scanning.

scanning-dwell-time.description:
Amount of time, in milliseconds, the radio will spend on a
        channel during scanning-interval. If a Monitor-mode Radio, it will
        cycle through scanning-allowed-channels spending this amount of time
        on each.

scanning-defer-clients.description:
Do not perform scanning if this amount of Stations are Associated
        to the Radio.

scanning-defer-traffic.description:
Do not perform scanning if any traffic received from an active Station
        in the past 100ms marked as AC_VO or AC_VI.

items.description: Allowed channel list for this Radio to utilize.

config.description:
Configurable items at the global, radio interface
            level

enabled.description: The desired operational state (up/down) of this radio interface.

transmit-power.description: Transmit power of the radio, in dBm.

channel.description:
Operating channel of this radio. If using channel-bonding this
        will represent the Primary 20MHz channel of the 40,80,160MHz channel.

dca.description: Utilize Dynamic Channel Assignment on this Radio.

dtp.description: Utilize dynamic transmit-power on this Radio.

dtp-min.description:
Minimum allowed transmit-power on this radio, if utilizing dtp.
        Expressed in dBm.

dtp-max.description:
Maximum allowed transmit-power on this radio, if utilizing dtp.
        Expressed in dBm.

antenna-gain.description:
Antenna gain applied to this Radio; typically used when
        external antennae connected.

scanning.description:
Whether the radio will perform off-channel scanning, to collect
        neighboring RF information.

scanning-interval.description:
How often, in seconds, the radio will go off-channel to perform
        scanning.

scanning-dwell-time.description:
Amount of time, in milliseconds, the radio will spend on a
        channel during scanning-interval. If a Monitor-mode Radio, it will
        cycle through scanning-allowed-channels spending this amount of time
        on each.

scanning-defer-clients.description:
Do not perform scanning if this amount of Stations are Associated
        to the Radio.

scanning-defer-traffic.description:
Do not perform scanning if any traffic received from an active Station
        in the past 100ms marked as AC_VO or AC_VI.

items.description: Allowed channel list for this Radio to utilize.

base-radio-mac.description:
Represents the 'burned-in' base-radio MAC
        address for the a Radio interface.

dfs-hit-time.description:
Reports the time of the last DFS hit. The value is the timestamp
        in nanoseconds relative to the Unix Epoch (Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

channel-change-reason.description:
When an Access Point changes channels, this will
        provide the reason that led to the change.

total-channel-utilization.description:
Total 802.11 and non-802.11 channel utilization on this Radio. The
        total channel utilization should include all time periods the AP
        spent actively receiving and transmitting 802.11 frames, and also
        include all time spent with clear channel assessment (CCA) in a
        busy state

rx-noise-channel-utilization.description: Received channel-utilization percentage due to Noise.

failed-fcs-frames.description: Number of frames that failed the FCS

noise-floor.description: Noise Floor, as measured by this radio.

failed-fcs-frames.description: Number of frames that failed the FCS

noise-floor.description: Noise Floor, as measured by this radio.

counters.description: A collection of radio-related statistics objects.

state.description: Operational state data at the global radio level

tags.description: Model for managing PHY layer configuration of Radio interfaces.
